item.title: Gaza ‘stabilization force’ commander outlines security plans
item.content:encoded: US Major General Jasper Jeffers said the Gaza “International Stabilization Force” will first deploy to Rafah.

item.title: Can Europe reduce its dependence on the US and at what cost?
item.content:encoded: Trump's tariffs, Greenland and defence spending are testing US-Europe alliance.

item.title: Trump suggests Iran has 10 days to reach agreement with US
item.content:encoded: US president says at inaugural Board of Peace summit that Washington and Tehran should make a 'meaningful deal'.

item.title: Trump praises ‘magnificent’ B-2 bombers that struck Iran in 2025
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump praised the “magnificent” B-2 bombers that “totally decimated the nuclear potential” of Iran.

item.title: Italy opposes Paralympics allowing Russia and Belarus to use flags, anthems
item.content:encoded: The two countries had been banned following the invasion of Ukraine, but had their rights restored last year.

item.title: Jordan-Israel relationship ‘at its worst’ after West Bank plans
item.content:encoded: Israel’s plan to restart land registration in the occupied West Bank is straining its relationship with Jordan.

item.title: Zimbabwe shock Sri Lanka to upset the T20 World Cup odds again
item.content:encoded: Zimbabwe chase down target of 179 to beat one of the favourites - and tournament co-hosts - Sri Lanka at T20 World Cup.

item.title: France hit by more than 35 days of rain
item.content:encoded: France endures more than 35 days of rain as floods worsen and Storm Pedro threatens Western Europe.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ convenes for first time
item.content:encoded: Led by US President Donald Trump, the “Board of Peace” convened for its first meeting to discuss Gaza reconstruction.

item.title: UN says Israel is stoking ‘ethnic cleansing’ fears in Gaza, West Bank
item.content:encoded: Intensified attacks, methodical destruction of entire neighbourhoods appear aimed at permanent displacement, UN says.

item.title: Amid tensions, Ukraine’s Chernobyl site remains part of a war zone
item.content:encoded: Al Jazeera's Nils Adler has seen how the site of the world’s worst nuclear disaster is affected by the war on Ukraine.

item.title: Bangladesh referendum: The big post-election flashpoint?
item.content:encoded: The referendum based on the July National Charter in Bangladesh has revealed divisions between the BNP and Jamaat.

item.title: Trump’s Board of Peace live: US president addresses inaugural meeting
item.content:encoded: US President Trump hosts the inaugural meeting of his so-called 'Board of Peace' in Washington, DC today.

item.title: What we know so far about arrest of UK’s former Prince Andrew
item.content:encoded: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor is in custody after being arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Real Madrid send ‘all available’ Vinicius evidence to UEFA in racism row
item.content:encoded: Real Madrid's Brazilian forward Vinicius Jr alleges he was racially abused by Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni.

item.title: Israel installed security at Epstein’s Manhattan apartment for ex-PM Barak
item.content:encoded: Investigation reveals the Israeli government installed surveillance equipment at a Jeffrey Epstein-managed residence.

item.title: Israeli raids in occupied West Bank at start of Ramadan
item.content:encoded: Israeli forces carried out violent raids across the occupied West Bank, detaining Palestinians and demolishing homes.

item.title: Slot offers Vinicius support, saying football ‘must do more’ against racism
item.content:encoded: Liverpool manager Arne Slot speaks out about racism in football and says it must do more to prevent future incidents.

item.title: What happened to ISIL?
item.content:encoded: At the height of its power, ISIL held around a third of Syria and 40% of Iraq.

item.title: Director rejects award over Israel’s genocidal war in Gaza
item.content:encoded: Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania leaves film award on stage, demanding accountability for genocide in Gaza.

item.title: The war on UNRWA: Gaza and the erosion of intl law
item.content:encoded: On Centre Stage, Al Jazeera’s Mohamed Hassan speaks with UNRWA’s commissioner general, Philippe Lazzarini.

item.title: UK King’s brother Andrew arrested on suspicion of misconduct
item.content:encoded: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, the former UK prince, has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Epstein’s shadow: Why Bill Gates pulled out of Modi’s AI summit
item.content:encoded: India’s AI summit was meant to showcase the country's potential, but controversy and Gates's exit stole the spotlight.

item.title: Updates: Ex-UK Prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor arrested
item.content:encoded: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was stripped of his title last year over his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Migrants are not responsible for the UK’s healthcare crisis
item.content:encoded: They are not a burden on the NHS, but a vital part of how it functions.
